content:
I have two questions about using the CatalogEntry resource:

  1. Is it on purpose that DeviceDefinition is not listed as potential target for CatalogEntry.referencedItem?
    This seems to contradict the statement "The DeviceDefinition resource contains the "catalog" definition of a device" in (Boundaries an Relationships of DeviceDefinition)[http://build.fhir.org/devicedefinition.html#bnr]

  2. How can a CatalogEntry be tied to a Catalog (assuming I have multiple Catalogs and want to associate the entries with a specific Catalog?
Any chance of discussing these questions at the WGM? I'd be happy to drop in on on one of the quarters...
FWIW - Thursday Q1 there is a joint with OO & DEV ... perhaps this could be a topic then.
agree, thursday Q1 would be a good time

Jose Costa Teixeira said:

CatalogEntry is deprecated

It's still in the R5 build: http://build.fhir.org/catalogentry.html
There's no mention of it being deprecated. What's intended as a replacement?
I'll see if I can join Thursday Q1.
The CatalogEntry is intended t o be abandoned. The contextual part of defining a product will be in the definition artifacts - MedicationKnowledge, DeviceDefinition, SpecimenDefinition

Hi @Simone Heckmann CatalogEntry was definitely ruled out in October 2019 after two years of debate between the Catalog project group and FMG. It should no longer be there. I assume that the clean out is pending @Lloyd McKenzie . The guidance for building catalogs of devices will be provided by the order catalog FHIR IG. We're discussing the device content of this IG these weeks, every Friday 6pm. Please, check the catalog tab on https://confluence.hl7.org/display/OO/OO+Meeting+Minutes .
Since CatalogEntry is owned by OO, I'll put removing it on my list to do (unless either Lloyd or Eric gets there first). Do you recall if we have a tracker for that (I assume we should)?

Note that this topic (use of DeviceDefinition in the order catalog FHIR IG) is also related to a topic within HL7 DEV for the IHE Patient-Device association management profile (IHE DEV PCIM, currently V2 based) and how that could leverage current FHIR constructs as well as the Workflow pattern.

The clean-out is the responsibility of the work group that created it - though someone can certainly ask for help if they need it. (Thanks @Rob Hausam. Any chance we can toast VisionPrescription too, now that it's subsumed by DeviceRequest?)
Yes, that's right. We can discuss VisionPrescription - maybe today? (need to check the agenda). @Hans Buitendijk @Riki Merrick @John David Larkin Nolen @Ralf Herzog @Lorraine Constable

Rob Hausam said:

Since CatalogEntry is owned by OO, I'll put removing it on my list to do (unless either Lloyd or Eric gets there first). Do you recall if we have a tracker for that (I assume we should)?

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-30632

Rob Hausam said:

Yes, that's right. We can discuss VisionPrescription - maybe today? (need to check the agenda). Hans Buitendijk Riki Merrick John David Larkin Nolen Ralf Herzog Lorraine Constable

when is that discussion? I'd like to join

Todd Cooper said:

FWIW - Thursday Q1 there is a joint with OO & DEV ... perhaps this could be a topic then.

I'll attend.
Looks like we should see about getting a vote on FHIR-30632. Maybe we could do that during the Catalog discussion in Q1 tomorrow?
